alert.note: Alert for Knox; Laurel; McCreary; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 12:59AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Laurel, southwestern Knox, northeastern McCreary and central Whitley Counties through 130 AM EDT... At 1259 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Deering, or 10 miles north of Williamsburg, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Williamsburg, Woodbine, Rockholds and Moore Hill around 105 AM EDT. Wilton and Wofford around 110 AM EDT. Perkins, Arkle, Rossland, Bertha Station, Gray and Julip around 115 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Permon, Indian Creek, Dishman Springs, Emmanuel, Louden, Lowell, Bentley Station, Garrich, Swan Lake, King, Clate, Gausdale, Baileys Switch, Carpenter, Barbourville, Swanpond, Hubbs, Bryants Store, Boone Heights, Birdseye, Heidrick, Goins and Cannon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
